glossary.sub: Define and manage all terms related to the service.
glossary.load_error_desc: An error occurred while loading terms.
glossary.input_error_desc: Please enter both term name and definition.
glossary.add_error_desc: An error occurred while adding the term.
glossary.update_error_desc: An error occurred while updating the term.
glossary.ai_modal_desc: We can recommend additional terms based on your existing PRD and terms. Would you like to get recommendations?
glossary.ai_error: An error occurred while getting recommendations.
glossary.ai_remaining_terms: Continue reviewing remaining recommendations or get new suggestions.
glossary.first_term_sub: Create your team's glossary by adding the first term.
glossary.definition_placeholder: Please write the meaning of the term.
glossary.related_url_desc:
Add links to help members better understand the terminology.
- GitHub link where the term is actually implemented in code
- Figma link for visual understanding
- Any other links that help with understanding
glossary.delete_confirm_desc: Do you really want to delete this term?
glossary.delete_error_desc: An error occurred while deleting the term.
glossary.sequence_error_desc: An error occurred while updating the term sequence.
glossary.url_copy_error_desc: An error occurred while copying the link.
glossary.importance_modal_content_1: Terminology is the core of all service design.
glossary.importance_modal_content_2: Well-chosen terms are immediately reflected in variable names in development, component names in design, etc., and determine the team's speed.
glossary.importance_modal_content_3: Carelessly chosen inappropriate terms, or cases where terms are needed but missing, slow down the team and reduce the probability of success.
glossary.importance_modal_content_4: Carefully decide on terms that are appropriate for the service, and make sure everyone is well aware of and can use the decided terms.

export.title: Export your written content in your desired format.

termExplanation.title: Term Explanations

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: Refers to users or external systems that interact with the system. For example, 'administrator', 'regular user', 'payment system', etc. can be actors.

examples.0: â€¢ Regular user of a website

usecase.title: Use Case
usecase.description: Refers to the goals that actors want to achieve or tasks they want to perform through the system. Each use case is connected to a specific actor.

feature.title: Feature
feature.description: Refers to specific system functions needed to implement use cases. Each feature belongs to a specific use case and represents the actual functions that need to be developed.

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: Refers to rules and guidelines for how features should operate. Policies define the implementation direction and constraints of features.

examples.0: â€¢ Password must be at least 8 characters long
examples.1: â€¢ Payment can be retried up to 3 times on failure
examples.2: â€¢ Personal information must be stored encrypted
examples.3: â€¢ Order cancellation is only possible before shipping

termExplanation.footer_description: These terms are the components needed when designing services based on use cases.
